title: 112_hr6621
content: Technical corrections are made to various sections of the Leahy-Smith America Invents Act, including advice of counsel, transitional program for covered business method patents, joinder of parties, and dead zones in inter partes review and reissue of patents. Technical corrections are made to various sections of the Leahy-Smith America Invents Act, including reissue of patents, correcting inventor information, and filing requirements for inventor's oath or declaration. The Leahy-Smith America Invents Act makes technical corrections related to patent reissue, inventor information, and filing requirements for inventor's oath or declaration. Amendments to travel expenses and payment of administrative judges are effective as of September 16, 2011, and adjustments are made to patent term calculations. The Leahy-Smith America Invents Act makes technical corrections related to patent reissue, inventor information, and filing requirements. Section 373 of title 35, United States Code, is repealed, and financial management clarifications are made in section 42(c)(3) of title 35, United States Code. In the Leahy-Smith America Invents Act, amendments are made to the administrative costs of the Office relating to patents and trademarks. Additionally, provisions for derivation proceedings in the Office are outlined. The Leahy-Smith America Invents Act outlines provisions for derivation proceedings in the Office, allowing for the institution of a derivation proceeding when a petition demonstrates that the standards are met. A petition for an invention that is the same or substantially the same as a claim in a patent must be filed within one year of the patent being granted or the earlier application being published. The Leahy-Smith America Invents Act allows for derivation proceedings in the Office, with final decisions by the Director not being appealable. The provisions of title 35 and title 28 apply to interference proceedings declared after September 15, 2012. The Patent Trial and Appeal Board may act as the Board of Patent Appeals and Interferences for such cases. The Leahy-Smith America Invents Act allows for derivation proceedings in the Office, with final decisions by the Director not being appealable. The Patent Trial and Appeal Board may act as the Board of Patent Appeals and Interferences for such cases. In each year, 3 members shall be appointed to each Advisory Committee for 3-year terms that shall begin on December 1 of that year. Any vacancy on an Advisory Committee shall be filled within 90 days after it occurs. The Secretary of Commerce will determine the time and manner for amendments to take effect, appointing 3 members to each Advisory Committee annually for 3-year terms starting on December 1. Existing Advisory Committee members' terms may be terminated to implement the amendments. The amendments made by this Act will take effect on the date of enactment and apply to proceedings started after that date. Section 123(a) of title 35, United States Code, is amended for clarification. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
